hedline.hl1: Perlman Program Going to Shelter Island

abstract.p: Perlman Music Program, school for gifted young musicians, will move to Shelter Island, NY; original plan to move to Sagaponack was shelved after vociferous opposition from some neighbors there (S)

block.p: The Perlman Music Program, a school for gifted young musicians, has found a new home, but it won't be in Sagaponack. Instead, the program plans to move to Shelter Island, where it is under contract to buy the Peconic Lodge, a waterfront hotel, for $3 million. Subject to approval by the town Zoning Board of Appeals, which has to consider a zoning-change application, the purchase could go through by spring, putting the program in its new home this summer.

The lodge, set on about 30 acres, contains 3 main buildings, a dining hall and 21 cabins and will require minimum work to make it usable as a school as well as a hotel, said the Perlman lawyer, Patricia Blake of Melville.

The lodge, set on about 30 acres, contains 3 main buildings, a dining hall and 21 cabins and will require minimum work to make it usable as a school as well as a hotel, said the Perlman lawyer, Patricia Blake of Melville.

Last summer vociferous opposition from some neighbors greeted the news that the Perlman Music Program, directed by Toby Perlman and her husband, Itzhak, the violinist, was planning to build a campus on 20 acres of farmland in Sagaponack, not far from the Perlmans' home in East Hamptonents.

''After the story appeared we were contacted by people all over the area offering us property,'' said Suki Sadler, a co-founder and president of the program, which brings young string players from all over the world to the East End for four weeks of study.
